description:
Lindgomyces ingoldianus is a species of aquatic fungus that belongs to the phylum Ascomycota. It is a member of the class Sordariomycetes and the order Lulworthiales.

Lindgomyces ingoldianus is known to inhabit submerged woody debris in freshwater and estuarine environments. It plays a role in the decomposition of plant material in aquatic ecosystems.

The fungus produces small, dark-colored perithecia (fruiting bodies) that release ascospores for reproduction and dispersal. The ascospores are typically elongated and fusiform in shape, with or without appendages.

Lindgomyces ingoldianus is considered an important decomposer organism in aquatic habitats, contributing to the cycling of nutrients and the breakdown of plant biomass. It has been studied for its potential role in the ecology of freshwater and estuarine ecosystems.
